story.storykicker: Amber Heard has demanded USD 50,000 per month from Johnny Depp as spousal support.
story.storybody:
Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's divorce is currently among the most discussed of topics in the showbiz world, thanks to Heard's claims of physical and verbal abuse against her husband.

Depp and Heard got married last February after meeting on the sets of 2011's The Rum Diary. The estranged couple is now fighting a legal battle. Amber Heard, in her court documents, has demanded USD 50,000 as monthly spousal support from Johnny Depp.

According to a CNN report, Heard's claim for USD 50,000 is nowhere justified, as in her documents submitted to the court, her income is half the amount she is demanding from her husband. The document states, "...she has made almost USD 27,000 so far this year -- as of May 31."

Amber, who has starred in films such as The Danish Girl and Magic Mike XXL, has claimed almost USD 44,000 a month in expenses which include house rent, entertainment, gifts, pet supplies and fees of her agents and attorney.

Whereas Depp's net worth is estimated to be USD 400 million.

Heard, 30, said in court papers filed in Los Angeles last week that Depp, 52, had been abusive to her throughout their relationship, culminating in an argument during which he hurled a cell phone at her face and shattered objects in her apartment.

Depp's lawyer argued in a court document that Heard "is attempting to secure a premature financial resolution by alleging abuse".

A temporary restraining order requiring Depp to stay at least 100 yards away from Heard was issued by the court last week. Depp was also required to move out of the couple's shared downtown Los Angeles condominium. A hearing is scheduled for June 17.
